meanings.definition: Make as large or great as possible.
meanings.sent1: I will maximise my savings by putting money in a piggy bank.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to maximise her chances of winning by practicing every day.
meanings.sent3: Trying to maximise the number of cookies in the jar, he accidentally dropped them all.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to maximise the joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright sun helped maximise the colors of the flowers in the garden.

meanings.sent1: To maximise his time, he created a schedule for studying.
meanings.sent2: The chef wanted to maximise the flavors in the dish, so he added extra spices.
meanings.sent3: She tried to maximise the space in her tiny apartment by using clever storage solutions.
meanings.sent4: His ability to listen carefully helped him maximise his relationships with others.
meanings.sent5: The artist used different techniques to maximise the impact of her painting.
